author: National Bureau
text:
Taking cognisance of The Hindu ’s report on a Congress member accusing another of discrimination based on caste, the BJP has accused the Congress of double standards on the issue.

The Hindu had reported that the Congress’ SC cell chief for Ghaziabad district, Jitender Kumar, in a letter to party president Sonia Gandhi had accused another party leader of having publicly humiliated him using a caste slur at a meeting of the party’s district unit on February 3.

BJP’s SC Morcha chief Dushyant Kumar Gautam wondered why an FIR under the SC/ST Act was not registered and asked what the SC/ST Commission led by Congress leader P.L. Punia was doing in the case. Mr. Gautam said the Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi should ask his Ghaziabad district chief to resign.
title: ‘Cong. must sack its leader for castiest remarks’
